caption:
This image captures an aerial view of an industrial area dominated by what appears to be a steel mill or a similar manufacturing facility. The scene is filled with large, imposing buildings that are primarily of a dark, possibly metallic construction, sprawling across the composition.

Several columns of thick white or light gray smoke rise prominently from stacks scattered throughout the facility, blanketing the air and merging into a pervasive haze that mutes the color palette of the photograph with a bluish tint. The sources of smoke vary in intensity and dispersion, indicating different ongoing operations or processes within the plant.

Foreground details include a variety of industrial structures, some with flat rooftops and others with sloped or angled constructions, possibly for handling the internal logistics of materials. There are no visible human figures, emphasizing the scale and the mechanical nature of the setting.

In the background, the landscape flattens into what looks like more industrial or urban areas with similar constructions but less density. A river or another body of water is suggested by the presence of what appears to be a bridge and some open spaces that contrast with the tightly packed industrial foreground.

This setting indicates a heavy industrial activity, likely involving high-energy processes such as steel production, marked by significant emissions and a robust infrastructure designed to support such operations. The overall atmosphere suggests a work-oriented environment focused on production, with little attention to aesthetic considerations, and possibly contributing to environmental pollution.
title: Steel plant. (From the sites exhibition. For other images in this assignment, see fiche numbers 76, 77, 78, 79.)
